result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Silas E Patterson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Silas E Patterson in court.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Silas E Patterson. Attorney Amy E Spanczak  appeared in court on behalf of Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested Status Conference date to allow time to review Discovery with Defendant. State did not object. Court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference. Any motion are to be filed by November 16, 2022 end of business day. Case remains calendared in Branch 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Silas E Patterson appeared by video.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Silas E Patterson.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Roe. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Silas E Patterson in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel. Court REINSTATES $2,000 signature bond. All previously ordered conditions remain.  Case is adjourned in preliminary hearing court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Email correspondence with parties. Case scheduled for Return on Warrant on 08/11/2022 at 10:00 am, Br 16.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($2,000.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant having failed to appear with the conditions of his/her release, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel received and filed.  bm

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Silas E Patterson in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Defendant Silas E Patterson in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Silas E Patterson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.  Motion to dismiss "USE OF DANGEROUS WEAPON" ENHANCER by defense for lack of probable cause argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
